connector.description: Offers publish/subscribe, peer-to-peer (via a server), and RPC style messaging using the CometD/Bayeux protocol.

camel.sink.path.channelName.name: camel.sink.path.channelName
camel.sink.path.channelName.description: The channelName represents a topic that can be subscribed to by the Camel endpoints.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins
camel.sink.endpoint.allowedOrigins.description: The origins domain that support to cross, if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

camel.sink.endpoint.baseResource.name: camel.sink.endpoint.baseResource
camel.sink.endpoint.baseResource.description: The root directory for the web resources or classpath. Use the protocol file: or classpath: depending if you want that the component loads the resource from file system or classpath. Classpath is required for OSGI deployment where the resources are packaged in the jar

camel.sink.endpoint.crossOriginFilterOn.name: camel.sink.endpoint.crossOriginFilterOn
camel.sink.endpoint.crossOriginFilterOn.description: If true, the server will support for cross-domain filtering

camel.sink.endpoint.filterPath.name: camel.sink.endpoint.filterPath
camel.sink.endpoint.filterPath.description: The filterPath will be used by the CrossOriginFilter, if the crosssOriginFilterOn is true

camel.sink.endpoint.interval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.interval
camel.sink.endpoint.interval.description: The client side poll timeout in milliseconds. How long a client will wait between reconnects

camel.sink.endpoint.jsonCommented.name: camel.sink.endpoint.jsonCommented
camel.sink.endpoint.jsonCommented.description: If true, the server will accept JSON wrapped in a comment and will generate JSON wrapped in a comment. This is a defence against Ajax Hijacking.

camel.sink.endpoint.maxInterval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.maxInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.maxInterval.description: The max client side poll timeout in milliseconds. A client will be removed if a connection is not received in this time.

camel.sink.endpoint.multiFrameInterval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.multiFrameInterval
camel.sink.endpoint.multiFrameInterval.description: The client side poll timeout, if multiple connections are detected from the same browser.

camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.sink.endpoint.timeout
camel.sink.endpoint.timeout.description: The server side poll timeout in milliseconds. This is how long the server will hold a reconnect request before responding.

camel.sink.endpoint.disconnectLocalSessi.name: camel.sink.endpoint.disconnectLocalSession
camel.sink.endpoint.disconnectLocalSessi.description: Whether to disconnect local sessions after publishing a message to its channel. Disconnecting local session is needed as they are not swept by default by CometD, and therefore you can run out of memory.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.cometd.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.cometd.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.cometd.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.cometd.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.cometd.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.cometd.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.cometd.extensions.name: camel.component.cometd.extensions
camel.component.cometd.extensions.description: To use a list of custom BayeuxServer.Extension that allows modifying incoming and outgoing requests.

camel.component.cometd.securityPolicy.name: camel.component.cometd.securityPolicy
camel.component.cometd.securityPolicy.description: To use a custom configured SecurityPolicy to control authorization

camel.component.cometd.sslKeyPassword.name: camel.component.cometd.sslKeyPassword
camel.component.cometd.sslKeyPassword.description: The password for the keystore when using SSL.

camel.component.cometd.useGlobalSslConte.name: camel.component.cometd.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.cometd.useGlobalSslConte.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
